animal_concentrations.References: (1) Addison RF et al; Mar Environ Res 47: 225-40 (1999) (2) Wiberg K et al; Chemosphere 24:  1431-9 (1992) (3) Hashimoto S et al; Chemosphere 37: 951-9 (1998)
animal_concentrations.Value: The concn of 1,2,3,7,8,9-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin in Sable Island, Newfoundland, Canada,  grey seal tissues (sampled in February 1995) were as follows(1): maternal blubber, 1.56 pg/g  lipid (n=1); maternal milk, 0.53, 0.32 pg/g lipid (n=2); and maternal blood, 200 pg/g lipid  (n=1). Osprey muscle tissue sampled in Sweden contained 1,2,3,7,8,9-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin  at a concn of 0.6 parts per trillion fresh wt(2). Oysters and mussels sampled from southern  coastal areas of South Korea between 1995-97 contained 1,2,3,7,8,9-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin  at a concns of <0.02-0.091 and 0.032 pg/g wet wt, respectively(3).

fish_seafood_concentrations.References: (1) Startin JR et al; Chemosphere 20: 793-8 (1990) (2) Fiedler H et al; Chemosphere 37: 1645-56 (1998) (3) Ferrario J et al; Anal Chem 68: 647-52 (1996) (4) Frommberger R; Chemosphere 22: 29-38 (1991) (5) Wiberg K et al; Chemosphere 24: 1431-9 (1992)
fish_seafood_concentrations.Value: Retail fish purchased in Norwich, United Kingdom had 1,2,3,7,8,9-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin concns as follows (all ng/kg wet wt)(1): plaice, 0.02-0.05; mackerel, 0.02; herring, 0.07; cod, <0.02; skate, 0.04; coley, <0.04. Farm-raised catfish from Mississippi, Alabama, and Arkansas contained significant levels of 1,2,3,7,8,9-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin(2); for example, brand A nuggets, 5.9-6.8 pg/g lipid (n=3); brand A filet, 11-18 pg/g lipid (n=3); brand B filet, 15 (n=3); Mississippi commercial, 4.2-12 (n=3); AK commercial, 5.7-6.1 (n=2)(2). Using sampling from 1993 US slaughter information, the mean concn of 1,2,3,7,8,9-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin was 0.963 pg/g lipid(3). Fishes sampled between 1987-1988 in southwest Germany from the rivers Rhine and Neckar contained 1,2,3,7,8,9-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin at concns as follows (all ng/kg fat wt)(4): eel, <0.7-2.6; brown trout, <0.2; grayling, <1.6; barbel, 1.1; carp, 0.8; chub, <0.8. Salmon muscle tissue sampled in Sweden contained 1,2,3,7,8,9-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin at a concn of <0.3 parts per trillion fresh wt(5).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Rotard W et al; Chemosphere 29: 2193-200 (1994) (2) Kjeller LO et al; Environ Sci Technol 25: 1619-27 (1995) Jimenez B et al; Chemosphere 32: 1327-48 (1996) (4) Schuhmacher M et al; Chemosphere 39: 49-429 (1999) (5) Alawi MA et al; Chemosphere 32: 907-12 (1996) (6) Broman D et al; Chemosphere 21: 1213-20 (1990)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SOIL: In a rural district in the western part of Germany, the mean concn of 1,2,3,7,8,9-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin was determined in the following in soils (all ng/kg dry matter)(1): plowland, 2.0 (n=14; range 1.6-2.4); grassland, 1.7 (n=7); deciduous forests, 19.1 (n=9; range 3.6-82.0); and coniferous forests, 16.2 (n=11; range 5.3-54.3). Archived soil samples collected from the same plot in southeast England between the period 1846-1986 range from 160 to 520 pg/kg(2). Soil samples collected in the surroundings of chemical waste incinerator (CWI) in Madrid, Spain contained 1,2,3,7,8,9-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin at concns ranging from not detected to 4.50 pg/g (detection limit, 0.02-0.51 pg/g)(3). The concn of 1,2,3,7,8,9-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin in soil samples collected in the vicinity of a municipal solid waste incinerator (MSWI) in Tarrogona, Spain ranged from 0.35-0.70 ng/kg dry wt in 1996 and 0.51-0.96 ng/kg dry wt in 1997(4). The concn of 1,2,3,7,8,9-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin in soil from an old landfill near Marka (north of Amman), Jordan, which was used for more than 35 years, ranged from <10 to 567 ng/kg dry wt(5). The concn of 1,2,3,7,8,9-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin in soil and soil near roadways sampled at Stockholm, Sweden ranged from <1.6-11 pg TEQ/g (n=4) and 5.0-16.6 pg TEQ/g (n=4), respectively(6).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Rappe C et al; Chemosphere 10-12: 1701-6 (1990) (2) Bruckmeier BFA et al; Environ Pollut  95: 19-25 (1997) (3) Bellucci LG et al; Marine Pollut Bull 40: 65-76 (2000)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SEDIMENT: In Sweden, the concn of 1,2,3,7,8,9-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin in sediments 3 and 10  kilometers from a pulp and paper mill were 2.7 and 2.5 pg/g dry wt, respectively(1). The concn  of 1,2,3,7,8,9-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin in sediments of Grober Arbersee (near  Bayerisch-Eisenstein in the Bavarian Forest, southeast Germany) increased between the approx  years 1951 to 1993(2); between the years 1865-1918, it was not detected; 1951-1957, 0.54 ng/kg  dry wt; 1957-1963, 0.53 ng/kg dry wt; 1963-1968, 2.64 ng/kg dry wt; 1968-1972, 1.93 ng/kg dry  wt; 1972-1977, 3.75 ng/kg dry wt; 1977-1981, 5.59 ng/kg dry wt; 1981-1985, 11.06 ng/kg dry wt;  1991-1993, 6.68 ng/kg dry wt(2). At 24 sites from the Venice lagoon, Italy, the concn of  1,2,3,7,8,9-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin ranged from <0.003 to 0.184 ug/kg(3). The concn of  1,2,3,7,8,9-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin in stormwater sediment (collected in sediment traps)  from Bayreath, Germany ranged from 4.2-19 ng/kg(4); the concn of  1,2,3,7,8,9-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin in other sediments also from this urban location were  as follows (all ng/kg): industry runoff, 1.7; household runoff, 2.4; runoff, 2.0; runoff basin  sediments, 4.0(4).
